intro: Biscutella asperifolia, commonly known as the roughleaf biscuitroot, is a flowering plant native to the western United States and parts of Canada. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes mustard and cabbage plants, and is characterized by its small, yellow flowers and hairy stems. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Its leaves are usually narrow and covered in fine, stiff hairs, giving it a rough texture. Biscutella asperifolia is also known for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional herbal remedies.
